title: Depersonalization Disorder: Clinical Overview and Diagnostic Considerations
short_description: A clinical document describing depersonalization disorder, a psychiatric condition characterized by feelings of detachment from one's sense of self and reality.
long_description: This clinical reference document provides a comprehensive overview of depersonalization disorder, a psychiatric condition that affects an individual's perception of their sense of self and reality. The document covers the disorder's key characteristics, including feelings of detachment and being an outside observer of one's own mental processes or body. It discusses potential triggers such as traumatic events, demographic patterns showing higher prevalence in women and individuals aged 15-30, and diagnostic approaches requiring comprehensive physical and psychiatric evaluations to rule out other medical conditions or substance-related causes.
